attributes.name: {{ember-table}}
attributes.description:
The primary Ember Table component. This component represents the root of the table, and manages high level state of all of its subcomponents. It does not have any arguments or actions itself - instead, all of those concerns are delegated to its children, who communicate to each other via the API.

<EmberTable as |t|>
  <t.head @columns={{columns}} />
  <t.body @rows={{rows}} />
  <t.foot @rows={{footerRows}} />
</EmberTable>

yields.name: table
yields.description: - the API object yielded by the table

yields.name: table.head
yields.description: - The table header component

yields.name: table.body
yields.description: - The table body component

yields.name: table.foot
yields.description: - The table footer component

attributes.name: {{ember-tbody}}
attributes.description:
The table body component. This component manages the main bulk of the rows of the table, provided occlusion for them and managing their behavior. It yields a template for each row, and an API that contains a row component, the row value, and the meta object for the row.

<EmberTable as |t|>
  <t.head @columns={{columns}} />

  <t.body @rows={{rows}} as |b|>
    <b.row>
  </t.body>
</EmberTable>

arguments.name: api
arguments.description: The API object passed in by the table

arguments.name: checkboxSelectionMode
arguments.description: Sets which row selection behavior to follow. Possible values are 'none' (clicking on a row does nothing), 'single' (clicking on a row selects it and deselects other rows), and 'multiple' (multiple rows can be selected through ctrl/cmd-click or shift-click).

arguments.name: rowSelectionMode
arguments.description: Sets which checkbox selection behavior to follow. Possible values are 'none' (clicking on a row does nothing), 'single' (clicking on a row selects it and deselects other rows), and 'multiple' (multiple rows can be selected through ctrl/cmd-click or shift-click).

arguments.name: selectingChildrenSelectsParent
arguments.description: When true, this option causes selecting all of a node's children to also select the node itself.

arguments.name: selection
arguments.description: The currently selected rows. Can either be an array or an individual row.

arguments.name: onSelect
arguments.description: An action that is called when the row selection of the table changes. Will be called with either an array or individual row, depending on the checkboxSelectionMode.

arguments.name: estimateRowHeight
arguments.description: Estimated height for each row. This number is used to decide how many rows will be rendered at initial rendering.

arguments.name: staticHeight
arguments.description: A flag that controls if all rows have same static height or not. By default it is set to false and row height is dependent on its internal content. If it is set to true, all rows have the same height equivalent to estimateRowHeight.

arguments.name: bufferSize
arguments.description: The number of extra rows to render on either side of the table's viewport

arguments.name: renderAll
arguments.description: A flag that tells the table to render all of its rows at once.

arguments.name: firstReached
arguments.description: An action that is triggered when the table reaches the first row.

arguments.name: lastReached
arguments.description: An action that is triggered when the table reaches the last row.

arguments.name: firstVisibleChanged
arguments.description: An action that is triggered when the first visible row of the table changes.

arguments.name: lastVisibleChanged
arguments.description: An action that is triggered when the last visible row of the table changes.

arguments.name: enableTree
arguments.description: Boolean flag that enables tree behavior if items have a children property

arguments.name: enableCollapse
arguments.description: Boolean flag that enables collapsing tree nodes

arguments.name: rows
arguments.description: The row items that the table should display

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: This key is the property used by the collection to determine whether an array mutation is an append, prepend, or complete replacement. It is also the key that is passed to the actions, and can be used to restore scroll position with idForFirstItem. This is passed through to the vertical-collection.

arguments.name: idForFirstItem
arguments.description: The property is passed through to the vertical-collection. If set, upon initialization the scroll position will be set such that the item with the provided id is at the top left on screen. If the item with id cannot be found, scrollTop is set to 0.

arguments.name: containerSelector
arguments.description: A selector string that will select the element from which to calculate the viewable height.

yields.name: body
yields.description: - the API object yielded by the table body

yields.name: body.row
yields.description: - The table row component

yields.name: body.rowValue
yields.description: - The value for the currently yielded row

yields.name: body.rowMeta
yields.description: - The meta for the currently yielded row

attributes.name: {{ember-td}}
attributes.description:
The table cell component. This component manages cell level concerns, yields the cell value, column value, row value, and all of their associated meta objects.

<EmberTable as |t|>
<t.head @columns={{columns}} />

<t.body @rows={{rows}} as |b|>
<b.row as |r|>
<r.cell as |cellValue columnValue rowValue cellMeta columnMeta rowMeta|>

</r.cell>
</b.row>
</t.body>
</EmberTable>

arguments.name: api
arguments.description: The API object passed in by the table row

arguments.name: onClick
arguments.description: Action sent when the user clicks this element

arguments.name: onDoubleClick
arguments.description: Action sent when the user double clicks this element

yields.name: cellValue
yields.description: - The value of the cell

yields.name: columnValue
yields.description: - The column definition

yields.name: rowValue
yields.description: - The row definition

yields.name: cellMeta
yields.description: - The meta object associated with the cell

yields.name: columnMeta
yields.description: - The meta object associated with the column

yields.name: rowMeta
yields.description: - The meta object associated with the row

attributes.name: {{ember-tfoot}}
attributes.description:
The table footer component. This component manages any footer rows which may be attached to the table, and has the same API as EmberTBody. It does not provide occlusion, because the number of footer rows is expected to be relatively small.

<EmberTable as |t|>
  <t.head @columns={{columns}} />
  <t.body @rows={{rows}} />

  <t.foot @rows={{footerRows}} as |f|>
    <f.row>
  </t.foot>
</EmberTable>

yields.name: foot
yields.description: - the API object yielded by the table footer

yields.name: foot.row
yields.description: - The table row component

yields.name: foot.rowValue
yields.description: - The value for the currently yielded row

yields.name: foot.rowMeta
yields.description: - The meta for the currently yielded row

attributes.name: {{ember-th}}
attributes.description:
The table header cell component. This component manages header cell level concerns, and yields the column value and column meta data objects.

<EmberTable as |t|>
  <t.head @columns={{columns}} as |h|>
    <h.row as |r|>
      <r.cell as |columnValue columnMeta|>

      </r.cell>
    </h.row>
  </t.head>

  <t.body @rows={{rows}} />
</EmberTable>

arguments.name: api
arguments.description: The API object passed in by the table row

arguments.name: onContextMenu
arguments.description: Action sent when the user clicks right this element

yields.name: columnValue
yields.description: - The column definition

yields.name: columnMeta
yields.description: - The meta object associated with this column

attributes.name: {{ember-th/resize-handle}}
attributes.description:
The table header cell resize handle component. This component renders an area to grab to resize a column.

<EmberTable as |t|>
  <t.head @columns={{columns}} as |h|>
    <h.row as |r|>
      <r.cell as |columnValue columnMeta|>
        {{columnValue.name}}

        <EmberTh::ResizeHandle @columnMeta={{columnMeta}} />
      </r.cell>
    </h.row>
  </t.head>

  <t.body @rows={{rows}} />
</EmberTable>

arguments.name: columnMeta
arguments.description: The API object passed in by the table header cell

attributes.name: {{ember-th/sort-indicator}}
attributes.description:
The table header cell sort indicator component. This component renders the state of the sort on the column (ascending/descending/none).

<EmberTable as |t|>
  <t.head @columns={{columns}} as |h|>
    <h.row as |r|>
      <r.cell as |columnValue columnMeta|>
        {{columnValue.name}}

        <EmberTh::SortIndicator @columnMeta={{columnMeta}} />
      </r.cell>
    </h.row>
  </t.head>

  <t.body @rows={{rows}} />
</EmberTable>

arguments.name: columnMeta
arguments.description: The API object passed in by the table header cell

yields.name: columnMeta
yields.description: - The meta object associated with this column

attributes.name: {{ember-thead}}
attributes.description:
The table header component. This component manages and receives the column definitions for the table, and yields for each row of headers that exists (in the case of subcolumns).

<EmberTable as |t|>
  <t.head @columns={{columns}} as |h|>

  </t.head>

  <t.body @rows={{rows}} />
</EmberTable>

arguments.name: api
arguments.description: The API object passed in by the table

arguments.name: columns
arguments.description: The column definitions for the table

arguments.name: sorts
arguments.description: An ordered array of the sorts applied to the table

arguments.name: sortFunction
arguments.description: An optional sort. If not specified, defaults to , which sorts by each sort in sorts, in order.

arguments.name: compareFunction
arguments.description: An ordered array of the sorts applied to the table

arguments.name: sortEmptyLast
arguments.description: Flag that allows to sort empty values after non empty ones

arguments.name: enableReorder
arguments.description: Flag that toggles reordering in the table

arguments.name: enableResize
arguments.description: Flag that toggles resizing in the table

arguments.name: resizeMode
arguments.description: Sets which column resizing behavior to use. Possible values are standard (resizing a column pushes or pulls all other columns) and fluid (resizing a column subtracts width from neighboring columns).

arguments.name: fillMode
arguments.description:
A configuration that controls how columns shrink (or extend) when total column width does not match table width. Behavior of column modification is as follows:

  • "equal-column": extra space is distributed equally among all columns
  • "first-column": extra space is added into the first column.
  • "last-column": extra space is added into the last column.
  • "nth-column": extra space is added into the column defined by fillColumnIndex.

arguments.name: fillColumnIndex
arguments.description: A configuration that controls which column shrinks (or extends) when fillMode is 'nth-column'. This is zero indexed.

arguments.name: widthConstraint
arguments.description:
Sets a constraint on the table's size, such that it must be greater than, less than, or equal to the size of the containing element. Valid values:

  • 'none'
  • 'eq-container'
  • 'gte-container'
  • 'lte-container'

arguments.name: containerWidthAdjustment
arguments.description: A numeric adjustment to be applied to the constraint on the table's size.

arguments.name: onHeaderAction
arguments.description: An action that is sent when sorts is updated

arguments.name: onUpdateSorts
arguments.description: An action that is sent when sorts is updated

arguments.name: onReorder
arguments.description: An action that is sent when columns are reordered

arguments.name: onResize
arguments.description: An action that is sent when columns are resized

yields.name: head
yields.description: - the API object yielded by the table header

yields.name: head.row
yields.description: - The table row component

attributes.name: {{ember-tr}}
attributes.description:
The table row component. This component manages row level concerns, and yields an API object that contains the cell component, the cell/column/row values, and the cell/column/row meta objects. It is used in both the header and the body, mirroring the structure of native HTML tables.

<EmberTable as |t|>
  <t.head @columns={{columns}} as |h|>
    <h.row as |r|>
      <r.cell>
    </h.row>
  </t.head>

  <t.body @rows={{rows}} as |b|>
    <b.row as |r|>
      <r.cell>
    </b.row>
  </t.body>
</EmberTable>

arguments.name: api
arguments.description: The API object passed in by the table body, header, or footer

arguments.name: onClick
arguments.description: Action sent when the user clicks this element

arguments.name: onDoubleClick
arguments.description: Action sent when the user double clicks this element

yields.name: row
yields.description: - the API object yielded by the table row

yields.name: row.cell
yields.description: - The table cell contextual component

yields.name: row.cellValue
yields.description: - The value for the currently yielded cell

yields.name: row.cellMeta
yields.description: - The meta for the currently yielded cell

yields.name: row.columnValue
yields.description: - The value for the currently yielded column

yields.name: row.columnMeta
yields.description: - The meta for the currently yielded column

yields.name: row.rowValue
yields.description: - The value for the currently yielded row

yields.name: row.rowMeta
yields.description: - The meta for the currently yielded row
